title: AZ-104 Virtual Machines and Compute Questions
description: Focused question bank for Azure Virtual Machines and Compute services

questions.question: You need to ensure that a virtual machine can be accessed from the internet. What must you configure?
questions.correct_answer: Public IP address and Network Security Group rules
questions.explanation: To access a VM from the internet, you need both a public IP address assigned to the VM or load balancer and appropriate NSG rules to allow the traffic.

questions.question: What is the maximum number of data disks that can be attached to a Standard_DS1_v2 virtual machine?
questions.explanation: The Standard_DS1_v2 VM size supports a maximum of 2 data disks. Different VM sizes have different limits for data disks.

questions.question: Which Azure service should you use to automatically patch virtual machines?
questions.explanation: Azure Automation Update Management helps you manage operating system updates for Windows and Linux machines in Azure, on-premises, and other cloud environments.

questions.question: What happens to the temporary disk when a virtual machine is stopped (deallocated)?
questions.correct_answer: Data on the temporary disk is lost
wrong_answers: Data is moved to the OS disk
Data is moved to persistent storage
questions.explanation: The temporary disk provides short-term storage and data is lost when the VM is stopped (deallocated). It should not be used for important data.

questions.question: Which VM size series is optimized for compute-intensive workloads?
questions.explanation: F-series VMs are optimized for compute-intensive workloads and feature a high CPU-to-memory ratio with Intel Xeon processors.

questions.question: What is the purpose of Azure VM extensions?
questions.explanation: VM extensions are small applications that provide post-deployment configuration and automation tasks on Azure VMs, such as software installation and configuration.

questions.question: Which feature should you use to ensure VMs in an availability set are updated during different maintenance windows?
questions.explanation: Update domains ensure that VMs in an availability set are rebooted at different times during planned maintenance, maintaining availability.

questions.question: What is the difference between Standard and Basic load balancer SKUs?
questions.correct_answer: Standard supports availability zones and has higher SLA
questions.explanation: Standard Load Balancer supports availability zones, has a 99.99% SLA, and provides advanced features compared to the Basic SKU.

questions.question: Which tool should you use to capture a generalized image of a virtual machine?
questions.correct_answer: Azure CLI or PowerShell with Sysprep
questions.explanation: To create a generalized VM image, you must first run Sysprep (Windows) or waagent (Linux) to generalize the VM, then capture it using Azure CLI or PowerShell.

questions.question: What is the purpose of proximity placement groups?
questions.correct_answer: Place VMs physically close together for low latency
questions.explanation: Proximity placement groups ensure that Azure compute resources are physically located close to each other to minimize latency between VMs.
